title: Alternative to Mrs. Eaves?
content:
Mrs. Eaves is a great font. However I have a client who doesn't see it that way. I am looking for an alternative with a taller x-height and possibly a bit more condensed. Perpetua is close, but not a winner.

Thanks.
author: kylehickman

comments.content:
What about Storm's [John Baskerville](http://web.archive.org/web/20150221133553/http:/www.stormtype.com/jbasker.html)? It even has a companion [sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20150221133553/http:/www.stormtype.com/jsans.html) family.

\_\_  
 [www.typeoff.de](http://web.archive.org/web/20150221133553/http:/www.typeoff.de/ "www.typeoff.de")

Sabon is a close match to Mrs. Eaves (or should I say Mrs. Eaves is a close match to Sabon).

[http://www.identifont.com/samples/emigre/MrsEaves.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20150221133553/http:/www.identifont.com/samples/emigre/MrsEaves.gif "http://www.identifont.com/samples/emigre/MrsEaves.gif")  
 [http://www.identifont.com/samples/adobe/Sabon.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20150221133553/http:/www.identifont.com/samples/adobe/Sabon.gif "http://www.identifont.com/samples/adobe/Sabon.gif")

Look at Monotype Sabon which is slightly more refined and narrower. I don't have source to show you.

Also, just found Arena New by Gunter Gerhard Lange on Berthold site. It's got a larger x-height and more condensed than Mrs. Eaves.  
 [http://www.bertholdtypes.com/bq\_library/90098.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150221133553/http:/www.bertholdtypes.com/bq_library/90098.html "http://www.bertholdtypes.com/bq\_library/90098.html")  
The sample is hard to review so I suggest downloading the PDF of Transitional type sample from their home page.

---------------------------------------------  
Yes, I'm old, but I'm back in style!
The sort of stylin' faux old feel is also in [Tribute](http://web.archive.org/web/20150221133553/http:/emigre.com/dp/getfontpage.php?STrbR.html), but your client might object to it as well.

I've always considered [FF Atma](http://web.archive.org/web/20150221133553/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&font_categories=1&font_categories_search=font_name_search&searchstr=atma) a nice alternative to Eaves. It's a huge, [versatile family](http://web.archive.org/web/20150221133553/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=virtual.content&area=sf_features&content=/virtual/fssf/features/fontmag/002/02_atma/index.htm) to boot. 3 different sizes of small caps? Mmm!

Everyone,  
Thank you for the great suggestions. I will post the winner when I have a happy client.

If you like Perpetua, there's a good chance you'll like [FF Scala](http://web.archive.org/web/20150221133553/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&font_categories=1&font_categories_search=font_name_search&searchstr=scala), though it's much more modern.

Can you tell us more about the client?

I have yet to get the client's input on this because my Creative Director would like to see more options.

My challenge is this:  
Find an easy-to-read, approachable, friendly, warm, smart but non-intimidating atypical font.

Any takers?

\>Find an easy-to-read, approachable, friendly, warm, smart but non-intimidating atypical font.

[Dolly](http://web.archive.org/web/20150221133553/http:/www.underware.nl/site2/index.php3?id1=dolly&id2=overview)  
Also, as Goudy is not currently so fashionable, but meets your criteria look at [Goudy Old Style](http://web.archive.org/web/20150221133553/http:/www.p22.com/lanston/products/goudyoldstyle.html) also [Deepdene](http://web.archive.org/) as well as the three versions of Goudy's Californian: from Fontbureau, P22, and ITC Berkeley.
